instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message:
Have a macbook air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) white no happy apple startup sound. Where should i start troubleshooting?

ASD passed without any errors

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message: Start by turning up the volume

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message: Turning up the volume before starting the mac :P

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message: Clean the board. Make PRAM reset. Boot OSX. Turn up volume. Restart. See if it chimes :-)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message: <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TON</SIGNAL> resistor. does this have cpu vcore?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message: Now i feel like lost in space... Im pretty new in motherboard.. How to check that <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TON</SIGNAL> have cpu vcore?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message:
It is working so TON resistor is fine. I assume you did a PRAM reset.

All audio circuitry is located on IO board so try new IO board and cable first.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no startup sound
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 4379"]It is working so TON resistor is fine. I assume you did a PRAM reset.[/QUOTE]

Feel me pretty stupid now.... it work with PRAM reset  ?
